>>245505691
Best I can do is offer a few hints on manual redrawing. First half of pic related is how to set up some hotkeys to increase/decrease brush size with shift+ctrl+mousewheel or shift+alt+mousewheel (you can choose any other hotkeys). tools-paint-brush-increase increases in steps of 1px while tools-paint-brush-increase-skip increases in steps of 10px. It's way easier to redraw when you can fine-tune your brush thickness with the mouse wheel
Another hint is to use jitter to make it more "hand-drawn like". I usually go for an amount of 0.2, but you can tune that. I also redraw using the Hardness 075 brush.

>>245541798
Because G-Witch's central conflict isn't as big as it sounds (even when the setting's macro conflict is indeed big and complex); it's pretty much a tale of an internal struggle inside one cyberpunk economic consortium, which isn't even the only big consortium in the setting.
The school will be the battleground for several conflicts inside the big one. We have:
>Prospera's revenge
>Delling's own personal agenda
>Jeturk, Peil and Grassley's machinations (do you think they will just bow down gracefully because their aces were defeated or Miorine bought their Gundam MS development teams?)
>The development of safe GUND technology
>Suletta and Miorine's personal demons.

I do think that we'll have a Earth arc at some point, which will deal with Miorine's personal issues but that and the final boss rush will be the only major battles fought outside the academy and its surroundings.

>>245539018
These may or may not have been foreshadowings.
Kubo is one of the writers who can integrate stuff he comes up with later into his work (in a way that doesn't exactly contradict anything) or can leave certain things vague enough to be filled with things he'll think of at a later point in time (an example would be Isshin being surprised that Ryuken calls him "Kurosaki" for he first during early HM arc, which shows he was setting up some stuff between them and Ichigo's mother all the way back then).
Of course he also could have actually came up with all that or a certain amount of it back then. There is evidence that he changed at least some of his ideas (like around the start of Arrancar arc showing future Aizen leading an army of Menos Grande back when they were still consideed a feasible threat. That was dropped for obvious reasons)
You can't really know how much exactly he planned and how much of it happened the way he wanted, because of his writing approach.

threads.sub: Uncle Go is still at it
threads.com:
Serialized in the physical version of Shogakukan's "Weekly Post", Yagyuu hadaka shinken (柳生裸真剣) is Go Nagai's latest manga series. It has been running since the May 21st of 2021 (published in May 10th, 2021). So far, the manga has been compiled into 3 tankobons.

>Summary and Synopsis:
Kan'ei 1 (1624). Yagyu Jubei served as a swordsmanship instructor for the third shogun Tokugawa Iemitsu. One day, as usual, Jubei finishes training at the dojo and goes to the bath, where Iemitsu sees him naked. Jubei was raised as a man because of his tremendous swordsmanship, but Jubei was a "woman". Iemitsu was surprised to see Jubei naked, but at the same time he was happy. Ever since he first saw Jubei at the age of 13, Iemitsu had been attracted to Jubei. Jubei rejects Iemitsu, who attacks him as a man. The two fight, and Jubei throws a deadly kick to Iemitsu, who tries to force him. Fortunately, Iemitsu only fainted, but Iemitsu has a violent temper. The Yagyu family may not be safe. Jubei returns home and tells his father Munenori Yagyu about the whole story, then Munenori lets Jubei escape. Iemitsu, who was proud of himself, probably wouldn't bring this matter to the public eye. However, behind the scenes, one-sword style assassins and official ninjas are certain to aim for Jubei's life.
Munenori orders Jubei to keep running until Iemitsu calms down. Thus began the desperate struggle between Jubei, who was pursued, and the terrifying assassin.

>>245541289
Why do you persist in passing off misinformation when I illustrated and explained why Megumi is the first girl? Merely being introduced first does not absolutely translate to 'first girl' in LN harem-romcom context. Senapi isn't the first girl for Hachiman and neither is Misaki for Sorata simply because they are the first female character that the MC interacted with first.

The first girl entails being the first and most relevant heroine the MC forms a relationship with, typically in the first volume. The cover of volume 1 normally reflects the first girl, but not always as there will be exceptions when there are two heroines on the first cover or the first girl is intentionally hidden for meta reasons (Sekano being an exception is the latter of the two). This is why Megumi, Yukino, and Mashiro are the first girl in their respective series.
